info.name: FnacDarty-370 Setup
info.description:
# Introduction

This configuration file is designed to be a basis for all configurations provided by Opencell.
It merely contains most common general settings and a catalog of services implementing various rating models.

# Configuring Opencell

There are 2 main ways for configuring ***Opencell***:
* GUI (*Administration GUI* and *Marketing Manager*)
* API (all Opencell configuration and operations can be performed using our extensive API library)

The most flexible way is using APIs which currently are available as **Rest** and **Soap**.
The **Soap** API are deprecated, so will won't mention them anymore.

## Tools

Any tools able to send HTTP requests will do.
One could even just script *curl* calls using shell script.
But of course, a more user friendly tool will make things easier.

Here at ***Opencell***, we prefer **Postman** (https://getpostman.com):
* it has a modern, friendly interface
* Sets of API request can be organized into collections, themselves structured into a folder tree.
* Collections can be exported as _JSON_ files or shared with other team members using collaboration features (payed version)
* it allows to uses variables at different levels (collection, environement, global) and to execute *Javascript* scripts before and after executing API calls which allows great flexibility and API response testing.



# Configuration documentation guidelines

In order to doucment our configuration, we make full used of the internal documentation capabilities of the 

## Default template for *Collection* documentation

## Default template for *Folder* documentation

## Default template for *Request* documentation



# Tips & guidelines

Here follow a few tips for understanding this collection.

## Collection pre-request script

```javascript
pm.globals.set("timestamp.iso", (new Date()).toISOString());
pm.globals.set("request.label", pm.info.requestName);

var parts = pm.info.requestName.split("|");

for(let i=0; i<parts.length; i++) {
    pm.globals.set("request.label."+i, parts[i]);
}
```

## Configuration guidelines

## Entities

<entity>_<project_code>_XXX

### Custom Fields

CF_<entity>_<project_code>_ XXX

<entity> will be discarded for inherited

#### Custom field visibility

SE_<entity>_<project_code>_<markers>_XXX

<markers> are used in CFT.applicableOnEl to show CFT on entities


## Entity abbreviation

| code  | entity                        |
|:-----:|:------------------------------|
|   P   | Provider                      |
|   S   | Seller                        |
|   C   | Customer                      |
|  CA   | Customer Account              |
|  BA   | Billing Account               |
|  UA   | User Account                  |
|  SU   | Subscription                  |
|  AP   | Access Point                  |
|  OF   | Offer Template                |
|  SE   | Service Template and Instance |
|  CH   | Charge Template               |
|  PP   | Price Plan                    |
|  CN   | Counter                       |
| ICAT  | Invoice Category              |
| ISCAT | Invoice SubCategory           |
|  CAL  | Calendar                      |
|  BC   | Billing Cycle                 |

    "description": "Mapping des codes offre",

request.description: Custom field aimed to flag a contract (Subscrition) in order to filter payments to represent or retry.
A Custom script to be referenced from 'PaymentCard_Job' filtering AOs to pay , based on CF_RETARY_PAYMENT value.
A Custom script to compute Previous Months Date range.
A Custom script to compute CUrrent Month Date range.
A script which will be used by PaymentRetryStatus_JOB, to change a contract retry flag value.
This JOB is parsing a flat file containing contracts references , to change massively their retry value.

}
